intro: Nicodemia diversifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved nicodemia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the rainy season. Nicodemia diversifolia is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky outcrops.
